message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

The paper discusses the use of deep neural networks, specifically the LSTM Encoder-Decoder model, for text simplification. This falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP), which is typically classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of machine learning techniques, which could also fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The LSTM model is a type of recurrent neural network, which is a popular model in the field of deep learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely category as well. The paper also discusses the potential for the model to learn and apply rules for text simplification, which could fall under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) or cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
